title: Connector Schema
description: An explanation of the purpose of this Connector Object

district_system_id.description: District System whose output is running through this connector/pipe

id.FIXME: may be there, type not known (string? number?)
id.description: Unique id used to refer to this feature within this dataset, generated by database.

lengths.description: Length of each segment in ft

geojson_id.description: Id of the geojson for this feature, managed by database.

legal_name.description: Legal name used to identify this feature.

project_id.description: Project which this feature belongs to, managed by the database.

source_id.description: Id of the feature in original data source.

source_name.description: Name of the original data source.

fuel.description: What kind of energy/fuel is this connector transporting? (Question: is this not determined by the connector's district system_id?)

maximum_rate.description: If the connector fuel is 'Electricity', said connector's schema now includes 'maximum_rate': an Integer representing the rate in kiloWatts.

connectorEndpoint.description: This object describes either the origin or the termination of this connector.

connection_endpoint_type.description: The connection_type indicates 'where' the connector endpoint resides, is this endpoint connecting to a District Energy System, a building or another connector?

building_id.description: If the connectorEndpoint type is 'Building', said connectorEndpoint's schema now includes building_id: foreign key associating this endpoint with said building.

junction_id.description: If the connectorEndpoint type is 'Junction', said connectorEndpoint's schema now includes junction_id: foreign key associating this endpoint with said junction
